title: Convenience Is the Cage: Why Redefining Wealth Is the First Step to Freedom
summary: Wealth isn't the number in your bank accountâ€”it's the number of needs you can meet without spending it. This fundamental reframe is the first step toward exiting systems of dependence.

Money.summary: Redefine wealth as access rather than accumulation, reducing reliance on cash systems.

level0: Audit where you spend money just to save time
Identify what you outsource that you could learn/share/trade
level1: Reclaim one area: start tool library, meal sharing, or childcare swap
Try one week without a convenience you normally pay for
level2: Create bulk cooking group or skill-sharing circle
Join or organize local barter network

Community.summary: Build post-permission systems that meet needs through relationships rather than transactions.

level0: Share one meal per week with neighbor to reduce prep and waste
level1: Start or join tool library, seed swap, or skill share
Create local group for bulk purchasing
level2: Start community garden or shared space

Knowledge.summary: Learn to measure wealth in terms of capability, access, and community rather than money.

level0: Track needs met without money instead of just income/expenses
level1: Learn about gift economy and mutual aid principles
level2: Develop skills in community organizing and resource coordination
level3: Teach others to build post-permission economic systems

Narrative.summary: Shift the story from scarcity and competition to abundance and cooperation.

level0: Practice describing wealth as access rather than accumulation
level1: Share stories of successful mutual aid and resource sharing
level2: Help others reframe their relationship to money and wealth
level3: Build cultural narratives around post-money abundance
